author: Pavan Dahat
text:
Four students from Maharashtra have been allegedly abducted by the Maoists in restive Bastar region of Chhattisgarh.

The students, who were on a “cycle tour” of Maoist insurgency-hit area of Maharashtra-Chhattisgarh and Orrisa, went missing on December 29.

According to some sources, the boys had entered Bastar through Bhatpar village in Gadchiroli–Bijapur district border and their last location was in Basaguda town of Bijapur district.

A person based in Nagpur was informed about the alleged abductions through a phone call from Sukma district of Bastar on Saturday.

Bastar Inspector General of Police, S.R.P. Kalluri told The Hindu that “all possible efforts would be made to save the boys if they have been abducted in Bastar.”
title: Maoists abduct four Maharashtra students in Bastar
